title: Angie Kent opens up about why she went looking for love on The Bachelorette
text:
Ahead of her debut on The Bachelorette, Angie Kent sat down for an interview with Studio 10 on Wednesday.

When asked why she agreed to appear on the reality dating show, the 29-year-old joked that she's an 'extremist'.

Prior to appearing on the show, Angie admitted she had dabbled with dating apps, but quickly realised they weren't for her.

Speaking out: Ahead of her debut on The Bachelorette, Angie Kent sat down for an interview with Studio 10 on Wednesday

'I did try Tinder once. I'm more of a got to be in the flesh, gotta smell ya, gotta feel the vibes, you know. Online stuff just doesn't do it for me,' she revealed.

But after failing to find love in the real world, Angie said she decided to try her luck on TV.

'I haven't been in love before. I peaked young in the boyfriend department,' she jokingly confessed.

Extreme dating: When asked why she agreed to appear on the reality dating show, the 29-year-old joked that she's an 'extremist'

'And then I just wanted to do the whole me. Explore the world, have a career, hang out with my friends, and just soul search.'

Angie said that up until now, she was 'never ready' to find love, and confessed she did indeed find it on The Bachelorette.

In an interview with The Daily Telegraph's Stellar magazine last month, Angie said she'd been happily single for 10 years prior to her appearance on The Bachelor.

Logging off: Prior to appearing on the show, Angie admitted she had dabbled with dating apps, but quickly realised they weren't for her

'I had three really good boyfriends right after the other. I started at 16 and stopped at 21. After that, I was more interested in travelling and studying, so I have not had a proper boyfriend since,' she confessed.

And she said she was determined to maintain her independence, even while filming the show.

'I didn't want to be morphed into a stereotypical Bachelorette. I wanted to feel like I [was] still me - strong and independent - and that the partner I pick would match that,' she added.
description: Ahead of her debut on The Bachelorette, Angie Kent sat down for an interview with Studio 10 on Wednesday. When asked why she agreed to appear on the show, Angie joked that she's an 'extremist'.
authors: Demeter Stamell For Daily Mail Australia
